issues.title: Epic: Fire Codes Wave A (11 states)
issues.body:
Deliver public-source coverage for NFPA 30 & IFC in Wave A states (OK, LA, NM, CO, ND, PA, OH, WY, WV, UT, AZ). Scope: discover public adoption/notice/rule pages, add to config, generate scrapers, validate extraction, and prep for RAG.

**Notes**
- Only public, non-paywalled sources (state fire marshal, admin code/rules, state register, ICC-hosted adoption pages, municipal notices).
- Avoid scraping paywalled code text; focus on notices, adopted-by-reference rules, errata, and change logs.
- Tag PRs/issues with `area:fire-codes` and `wave:A`.

**Deliverables**
- URLs added to `state-website-data/state-website-data.json` for each state.
- Scraper files generated in `scrapers/state/<code>/...`.
- Spot-validated extraction (`updated`, `new_content`, `meta`) for 2–3 sources/state.
- Follow-ups opened for tricky/dynamic sites.

issues.title: Wave A – Oklahoma: Research public fire-code sources (NFPA 30 & IFC)
issues.body:
**Find public sources** (no paywalled code text):
- OK State Fire Marshal / Fire Prevention adoption & notices
- IFC adoption references (state building code council if applicable)
- Admin Code/Rules that adopt NFPA 30 by reference
- State Register / rulemaking notices
- (Optional) 1 city or county adoption page

**Add** up to 2–5 URLs to `state-website-data.json` under "Oklahoma" with brief notes if needed.

**Search helpers**
- `site:.gov Oklahoma "State Fire Marshal" "fire code" adoption`
- `site:.gov Oklahoma "International Fire Code" adoption`
- `site:.gov Oklahoma "NFPA 30" "incorporated by reference"`
- `site:.gov Oklahoma register fire code`

**Acceptance**
- URLs collected and ready for generator.

issues.title: Wave A – Oklahoma: Config + generate scrapers + validate extraction
issues.body:
**Do**
- Add URLs to `state-website-data/state-website-data.json` for OK.
- Run generator with `--overwrite`.
- Spot-run 2–3 scrapers (incl. at least one PDF if present).
- Adjust selectors if needed (e.g., `main,article,.content`).
- Commit results.

**Acceptance**
- OK scrapers present and extraction returns sensible `new_content`/`meta`.

issues.body:
